location.desc: collation or annotation files, excluding level 3 footnotes
any main text of an edition (old spelling or modern), encoded using the SGML syntax.
introductory or supplementary materials, encoded in XML

attrTypes.type: The attribute is a non-empty string.
The attribute contains one more more comma separated items from a list.
The attribute contains one item from a list.

tag.name: ABBR
tag.desc: Used to expand old-spelling contractions, e.g. <ABBR expan="the">y<SUP>e</SUP></ABBR>

attribute.name: expan
attribute.desc: The expanded form of the abbreviated word. This will eventually permit searches on the word.

tag.name: ACT
tag.desc: Act division as in the modern edition.

attribute.name: n
attribute.desc: The number of the act. If the original includes an act division which has been retained, the notation would be thus: </ACT><ACT n="2"> <LD>Actus Secundus</LD>.

tag.name: add
tag.desc: Indicates a passage in an "extended" text that has been added from an alternative version. May contain LEM and RDG elements, or directly contain added text for the extended version (as if RDG were used around the entire contents).

attribute.name: wit
attribute.desc: An identifier for the textual "witness" that the passage came from. Omit if using a child RDG.

tag.name: AMBIG
tag.desc: Designates a word with alternative readings (marked up by child RDG elements) where a word in the source material is irreducibly ambiguous. Note: this is not a textual variant, but a product of the process of modernization.

tag.name: annotations
tag.desc: Root element of an annotation file.

tag.name: BACKMATTER
tag.desc: Surrounds all sections of an edition that follow the last scene. The actual division(s) of BACKMATTER are designated by the <DIV> tag, and include (and replace) such items as Epilogue, Colophon and so on.

tag.name: BL
tag.depreciated: Use BLL for black letter or L for blank line instead of BL.
tag.desc: Formerly blank line. Depreciated in favour of L.

tag.name: BLL
tag.desc: Black Letter (not to be confused with BL, previously the indication of a blank line).

tag.name: BLOCKQUOTE
tag.desc: Previously used to denote a quoted piece of text (e.g. letter).

tag.name: BR
tag.desc: Break between lines of hung-words. Should NOT be used to force line breaks in any other context.

tag.name: C
tag.desc: Centered text. This tag should be applied to a whole line, except for portions marked up by RA.

tag.name: CL
tag.desc: Closing statement (e.g. Finis).

tag.name: COL
tag.desc: Defines columns in a page.

attribute.name: n
attribute.desc: <COL n="0">...</COL> Defines pages with no columns in a document that elsewhere has columns. <COL n="1 | 2">...</COL> Column 1 or 2 (Folio).

tag.name: coll
tag.desc: Top level element for an collation. Contains information on the lemma in the text (<lem>), alternate readings (<rdg>), and notes about the variance (<general_note>).

tag.name: collations
tag.desc: Root element of a collations file.

tag.name: CW
tag.desc: Catchword

tag.name: DIV
tag.desc: Named Division of the text that is not an ACT or SCENE.

attribute.name: link
attribute.depreciated: Link attributes should be dropped from the text.

attribute.name: name
attribute.desc: Name of the section

tag.name: EM
tag.desc: Words to be emphasized.

tag.name: EPILOGUE
tag.depreciated: Use BACKMATTER with DIV instead of EPILOGUE

tag.name: FONT
tag.desc: This tag allows the editor to fine-tune font size where necessary, as, for example, on a title page.

attribute.name: size
attribute.desc: The normal (default) size is "3", the smallest "1" and the largest "6".

tag.name: FONTGROUP
tag.desc: This tag allows the editor to fine-tune font size where necessary, as, for example, on a title page.

attribute.name: n
attribute.desc: The normal (default) size is "3", the smallest "1" and the largest "6".

tag.name: FOREIGN
tag.desc: Surrounds a word or phrase in a language other than English. Used for the content of speeches only, not Latin stage directions, literary divisions etc. Example <FOREIGN lang="French">Diable!</FOREIGN>.

attribute.name: lang
attribute.desc: The name of the language used.

tag.name: FRONTMATTER
tag.desc: Surrounds all sections of an edition that precede the first scene. The actual division(s) of FRONTMATTER are designated by the <DIV> tag, and include (and replace) such items as Prologue, Epistle, Dedication and so on.

tag.name: H1
tag.desc: Heading for scenes in the modern text.

tag.name: H2
tag.desc: Heading for scenes in the modern text.

tag.name: H3
tag.desc: Heading for scenes in the modern text.

tag.name: H4
tag.desc: Heading for scenes in the modern text.

tag.name: H5
tag.desc: Heading for scenes in the modern text.

tag.name: H6
tag.desc: Heading for scenes in the modern text.

tag.name: HW
tag.desc: Hung-Word(s). Note that the hung-word should be restored to the line it continues; the "type" indicates whether it was originally displaced to the previous or next line. Multiple lines of hung-word content should be separated with BR.

attribute.name: t
attribute.desc: The type of hung-word indicates whether it appears on lines preceding or following the line it continues.

tag.name: iembed
tag.desc: Embedded content

attribute.name: site
attribute.desc: The ISE sub-site to fetch content from.

attribute.name: component
attribute.desc: The site component to fetch content from.

attribute.name: href
attribute.desc: identifier of the resource to embed

attribute.name: showCaption
attribute.desc: whether or not to display a caption with the embedded content

attribute.name: height
attribute.desc: height (in pixels) of the embedded content

attribute.name: width
attribute.desc: width (in pixels) of the embedded content

attribute.name: align
attribute.desc: how to align the embedded content within the host document

attribute.name: lightbox
attribute.desc: identifier of the large resource to show in the lightbox

attribute.name: longCaption
attribute.desc: long-form caption to show in the lightbox

tag.name: ilink
tag.desc: ISE link

attribute.name: site
attribute.desc: The ISE sub-site to fetch content from.

attribute.name: component
attribute.desc: The site component to fetch content from.

attribute.name: href
attribute.desc: the resource to link to

tag.name: I
tag.desc: Italic text.

tag.name: INDENT
tag.desc: Surrounds a passage indented in the original.

attribute.name: n
attribute.desc: Indicates the number of em spaces a block of text (verse or prose) is to be indented.

attribute.name: l
attribute.desc: Indicates the number of em spaces a block of text (verse or prose) is to be indented.

tag.name: iseHeader
tag.desc: metadata block

tag.name: J
tag.desc: Justified line. Only fully justified lines are tagged. Note that verse lines that reach to the end of the column should not be tagged as justified (though many draft texts do), since these are not justified in the way that prose lines are.

tag.name: L
tag.desc: Editor's line number. Mainly used in modern texts. Can also be used to mark blank lines so they will not be collapsed.

attribute.name: n
attribute.desc: Line number. Each scene is renumbered from 1.

attribute.name: part
attribute.desc: Used to create split-line groups, where each part is positioned as if it were on the same line as the preceding part. The first part in the group should be marked as part "i", intermediate parts as part "m", and the final part as part "f". See Editor Guidelines 4.4.8

tag.name: LABEL
tag.desc: Label

tag.name: LB
tag.depreciated: Use L on an empty line instead of LB to preserve empty lines.
tag.desc: Previously used for line break. <L/> is recommended.

tag.name: LD
tag.desc: Header for a Literary Division (e.g. Act, Scene.).

tag.name: lem
tag.desc: Surrounds the lemma for an annotation. The lemma will become the link on the text, and must be wholly accurate, including punctuation.

tag.name: lem
tag.desc: Surrounds the lemma for a collation The lemma will become the link on the text, and must be wholly accurate, including punctuation.

attribute.name: resp
attribute.desc: The witness the lemma is based on. Use "Ed" if the lemma was created by the editor.

attribute.name: subst
attribute.desc: Set to "true" on lemmas that differ from the witness' version, but are substantively equivalent. Default is "false".

tag.name: LEM
tag.desc: Used inside of ADD to mark text that will appear only in the non-extended version of the text.

tag.name: level
tag.desc: Surrounds the annotation content.

attribute.name: n
attribute.desc: The "level" of this annotation. Level 1 annotations are short, and tend to focus on basic meaning without context. Level 2 annotations provide longer, deeper explainations of meaning in context.

tag.name: LINEGROUP
tag.desc: Surrounds a structured group of verse lines.

attribute.name: form
attribute.desc: The form of the rhyme.

attribute.name: t
attribute.desc: The structure of verse.

attribute.name: rhyme
attribute.desc: The group's rhyming pattern, for example aabbcddc

tag.name: LINK
tag.desc: describes a relationship to another document

attribute.name: rel
attribute.desc: the kind of relationship, describe in the forward direction (how the linked resource relates to this one)

attribute.name: rev
attribute.desc: the kind of relationship, described in the reverse direction (how this resource relates to the linked one)

attribute.name: href
attribute.desc: identifier of the related resource

attribute.name: order
attribute.desc: order that this item will appear on the edition title page

tag.name: linklist
tag.desc: Provides a list of <linkText> describing witness names that should be linked to ISE editions when displayed

tag.name: linkText
tag.desc: A witness name that refers to an ISE edition.

tag.name: ln
tag.desc: The line numbers from the modern edition to which a collation or note is linked. The format of the content follows the MLA style: 1.3.33, for example.

attribute.name: tln
attribute.desc: Through-line number

attribute.name: qln
attribute.desc: Quarto line number

attribute.name: l
attribute.desc: Editor's line number.

tag.name: LS
tag.desc: Surrounds letter-spaced words (e.g., "G O D").

tag.name: BRACEGROUP
tag.desc: Bracegroup

tag.name: SPLITLINE
tag.desc: Line split into multiple lines

tag.name: MARG
tag.desc: Marginalia

attribute.name: loc
attribute.desc: Which page margin this text appears in

tag.name: META
tag.desc: A metadata item about the document.

attribute.name: name
attribute.desc: metadata key

attribute.name: content
attribute.desc: the metadata content

attribute.name: scheme
attribute.desc: format of the metadata content

tag.name: MODE
tag.desc: Indicator of verse or prose.

attribute.name: t
attribute.desc: Note that you may choose to use a type of "uncertain" where it is not clear that the section is either verse or prose.

tag.name: MS
tag.desc: Milestone

attribute.name: t
attribute.desc: Type of milestone

attribute.name: n
attribute.desc: Value of the milestone

tag.name: note
tag.desc: Top level element for an annotation. Contains information on the lemma to annotate (<lem>), and all level 1 or 2 notes attached to that lemma (<level>).

tag.name: note
tag.desc: Additional notes about the variant. Use as a child of <coll> when the note applies to the collation as a whole, or as a child of <rdg> when it applies to a specific reading.

tag.name: ORNAMENT
tag.desc: Self-closing <ORNAMENT /> is a printer's ornament. <ORNAMENT> </ORNAMENT> is used for decorative or large font letters only.

attribute.name: drop
attribute.desc: Marks this ornament as a drop-capital, and specifies the number of lines to span.

attribute.name: letter
attribute.depreciated: Give the letter in the content of the ORNAMENT element instead.
attribute.desc: The ornamented letter.

tag.name: PAGE
tag.desc: Indicates page breaks in the old-spelling texts.

attribute.name: n
attribute.desc: The "through page number" for the text.

attribute.name: sig
attribute.desc: The page signature in its normalized and accurate form. This will include all signatures that are implied rather than actually printed, and must include either "r" or "v" for recto and verso.

attribute.name: compositor
attribute.desc: The compositor(s) of this page.

tag.name: PN
tag.desc: Page number as printed.

attribute.name: n
attribute.depreciated: Use @n on the PAGE element instead.
attribute.desc: Actual page number where it differs from the printed number.

tag.name: POEM
tag.desc: a single poem in a collection of poems

tag.name: PROLOGUE
tag.depreciated: Use FRONTMATTER with DIV instead of PROLOGUE

tag.name: PROP
tag.desc: Identifies props to be used in the play when they are mentioned in stage directions or speeches.

attribute.name: item
attribute.desc: An unique identifier for the item. Where there are more than one in the play (in the case of multiple letters, for example) these should be designated "letter1" "letter2" etc.

attribute.name: desc
attribute.desc: A short description of the prop, if needed. Do provide the description for more than one instance of the same prop.

tag.name: PROSEQUOTE
tag.desc: Formerly a prose quotation (e.g. quoted letter).

attribute.name: source
attribute.desc: When the passage is a quotation from another source, the source should be recorded.

tag.name: Q
tag.desc: container for a collation reading's text when the reading also has an associated <note>.

tag.name: QLN
tag.desc: Quarto Line Number

attribute.name: n
attribute.desc: The line number.

tag.name: QUOTE
tag.desc: A Quotation.

attribute.name: source
attribute.desc: a short desecription of the source of the quoted material

tag.name: R
tag.desc: Roman type. This tag is used only in texts where the default font is black letter.

tag.name: RA
tag.desc: Right Aligned text. This tag may be applied to a portion of a line that is otherwise left aligned (the default), centered (with C), or justified (with J) so that only the indicated portion is affected.

tag.name: rdg
tag.desc: The reading of an editor or edition for an entry in the collation. One collation may contain multiple variant readings.

attribute.name: resp
attribute.desc: The edition or editor responsible for the reading.

tag.name: RDG
tag.desc: A Reading within an AMBIG or ADD.

attribute.name: wit
attribute.desc: An identifier for the textual "witness" that the passage came from. Omitted when used within AMBIG.

tag.name: RT
tag.desc: Running title.

tag.name: RULE
tag.desc: A horizontal rule. The tag is self-closing.

attribute.name: n
attribute.desc: Width of the rule in m-spaces. The default is a full width rule.

attribute.name: l
attribute.desc: Length of the rule in m-spaces. The default is a full page rule.

tag.name: S
tag.desc: Speech. Should include a speech prefix (SP).

tag.name: SC
tag.desc: Small caps.

tag.name: SCENE
tag.desc: Scene division as in the modern edition. Note: In plays with a non-diegetic chorus, like Henry V (F) and Pericles, use <SCENE n="0"> to designate chorus passages that are not prologues or epilogues. SCENEs may be used with or without enclosing ACTs.

attribute.name: n
attribute.desc: The number of the scene, not including any Act numbering.

attribute.name: link
attribute.depreciated: Link attributes should be dropped from the text.

tag.name: SD
tag.desc: Stage Direction. Consecutive directions of different kinds should be tagged separately.

attribute.name: t
attribute.desc: The type of the stage direction, a comma-separated list.

tag.name: SECTION
tag.depreciated: Use DIV with a name attrbute instead of SECTION.
tag.desc: Previously used as section divisions in essays and supplementary works.

attribute.name: n
attribute.desc: The section number or name.

tag.name: SIG
tag.desc: Page Signature. Encloses the printed page signature.

attribute.name: n
attribute.desc: The signature in its normalized and accurate form. This will include all signatures that are implied rather than actually printed, and must include either "r" or "v" for recto and verso.

tag.name: SP
tag.desc: Speaker(s) for the enclosing speech. Should appear before any speech text. If a prefix is not given in the source material, use an empty SP tag to indicate its omission.

attribute.name: norm
attribute.desc: Normalized form of the name. If there is more than one speaker, separate the noramlized names by commas.

tag.name: SPACE
tag.desc: Indicates significant space to be left in the text. The most common instance of this will be in formatting the lines of verse in a song or sonnet, where some lines will be indented further than others.

attribute.name: n
attribute.desc: The number of m-spaces should be indicated.

attribute.name: l
attribute.desc: The length of space, in em's.

tag.name: STANZA
tag.desc: Stanza of a poem. Use instead of ACT/SCENE/DIV in long-form poems.

attribute.name: n
attribute.desc: The number of the stanza.

tag.name: SUB
tag.desc: Subscript characters.

tag.name: SUP
tag.desc: Superscript characters.

tag.name: SWASH
tag.desc: Indicates an ornamental swash letter. DRE texts only.

attribute.name: where
attribute.desc: The direction of the swash ornament.

tag.name: SHY
tag.desc: Shy generated by {-}

tag.name: TITLE
tag.desc: Title of the work, often appearing in initial headings and introductory pages.

tag.name: TITLEHEAD
tag.desc: Title page material in quartos; initial heading in Folio.

tag.name: TITLEPAGE
tag.depreciated: Use DIV with a name attrbute instead of TITLEPAGE

tag.name: TLN
tag.desc: Through Line Number. The basic method of internal reference for the editions will be the TLN number. Where a quarto or modern edition omits material the numbers will be omitted; where they add material the numbers will be added decimally (<TLN n="1033.1"> etc.); where the line division varies from the Folio the TLN number will be that of the first word of the line.

attribute.name: n
attribute.desc: The TLN.

tag.name: var
tag.desc: "pop-up" variant to show on this lemma when it is hovered.

attribute.name: wit
attribute.desc: Name of the witness that the reading comes from.

tag.name: VERSEQUOTE
tag.desc: Previously used for a verse quotation (e.g. song).

attribute.name: source
attribute.desc: When the verse is a quotation from another source, the source should be recorded (as in Pistol's quotations from earlier plays).

tag.name: WLN
tag.desc: Witness Line Number.

attribute.name: n
attribute.desc: The WLN.

attribute.name: wit
attribute.desc: An identifier for the witness that the passage came from. If omitted, the source witness referenced in the metadata is assumed.

tag.name: WORK
tag.desc: The tag that surrounds the entire document.

attribute.name: genre
attribute.depreciated: Use metadata instead of the genre attribute.
attribute.desc: Previously used to decribe the work's genre.
